raw_text:
Based on the paper content, I'll extract the structured information following the guidelines:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Effects of BRAC's Targeting Ultra-poor Program in Bangladesh",
    "matches_expected_title": "YES"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "BRAC Targeting the Ultra-poor (TUP) Program",
    "country": "Bangladesh",
    "region": "Three poorest districts in Northwest Bangladesh (Rangpur, Kurigram, and Nilphamari)",
    "target_population": "Ultra-poor women"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "consumption support",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "The TUP program aims to improve the physical, human, and social capital of the poorest of the poor. A core activity of the program is to provide participants with a grant of specific physical assets."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock (cows, goats)", "tree nurseries", "pushcarts for vending"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "A core activity of the program is to provide participants with a grant of specific physical assets. | The TUP program then provides assistance for using the transferred assets effectively as a microenterprise. In particular, BRAC staff members offer ongoing training in specific enterprise activities notably livestock and poultry rearing, operation of tree nurseries, and village vending such as circulating around the village with a pushcart."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "income/earnings",
      "food security",
      "asset accumulation",
      "savings/financial",
      "health",
      "women's empowerment",
      "child labor",
      "education"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The survey contains a rich body of information regarding the asset base of the household that includes physical (land, rickshaw van, fishing nets), human (schooling, child labor, health), and financial (cash savings) capital. The data include information about basic needs (food security, clothing, and shoes/sandals), stock of household durables and income.",
    "study_design": "Panel data with difference-in-differences and matching",
    "design_evidence_citation": "This paper uses a two period panel data set (2002, 2005) to analyze the effects of the TUP program participation on a set of household outcomes",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2002-2005",
    "sample_size": 5067,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "This paper uses household panel data to provide robust evidence on the effects of BRAC's Targeting the Ultra-poor Program in Bangladesh",
    "country_citation": "TUP (phase I) was launched in 2002 in three of the poorest districts in Northwest Bangladesh (Rangpur, Kurigram, and Nilphamari)",
    "target_population_citation": "The exclusion criteria required that participating women must be capable of doing work outside the home, must not belong to another NGO program and must not receive a food benefits card."
  }
}
```
